name: Techspace
slogan: Move-in ready workspaces designed specifically for tech scale-up teams
description:
Techspace exists to empower fast growth technology companies. We provide frictionless and enriched workplace environments for our members, and are committed to the principles of community and innovation which underpin all aspects of our business.

The Techspace community now encompasses over 1,000 people across 5 buildings in East London, and is continuing to grow exponentially, with further locations opening in London, and expansion to Berlin over 2017. 

The Techspace community is curated through a selection process which grades aspiring members according to their level of technology and innovation, funding stage and calibre of investors, and ethics & integrity of the business sector and its co-founders. Techspace also encourages and incentivises its existing members to recommend other tech businesses who will fit our qualifying criteria.

team.name: David Galsworthy
team.bioHtml: Founder @Techspace 10+ yrs international business experience as an entrepreneur. Creating coworking environments & networks for tech startups since 2010

team.name: Alex Rabarts
team.bioHtml: Co-founder @Techspace • Worked at @Stateless Systems, @REA Group • Studied at @Imperial College London

jobs.title: IT Support Engineer
jobs.description:
Techspace is a flexible workspace provider for the tech community. We are looking for an IT Support Engineer to join our Technology team.

You’ll be working to implement, maintain and support our growing network infrastructure in London, Berlin and our expansion into new markets. You’ll be responsible for operating scalable, maintainable, highly available network architectures for Techspace and our members.

What you’ll be doing
- Improve agility, scalability and availability across all platforms, including assistance with the roll out of SD-WAN across our infrastructure.
- Perform network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches and security configurations.
- Monitor performance and ensure system availability and reliability.
- Maintain, bugfix and improve legacy networks, addressing technical debt.
- Interact with member companies and deliver customised connectivity solutions.
- Liaise with ISPs and appliance vendors.
- Hands on patching, debugging, predictive and on-site surveys, planning and provisioning.
- Manage IT assets and provide desktop support to the internal Techspace team.

What you'll bring
- Knowledge of our existing technology stack, including Fortinet appliances, Cisco switches, Juniper appliances and Ruckus Wi-Fi is advantageous, although the successful candidate will be one that is adaptable and not tied to specific vendors.
- Solid understanding of VDOMs, VPNs, VLANs.
- Understanding of AAA services including 802.1x and captive portal authentication management, integration and debugging.
- An interest in emerging network technologies.
- Desire to grow your skills, tackle interesting work and challenging problems.
- Ideally worked in a startup/young company or with sole engineering responsibilities before.
- Be proud of what you work on and obsess about the quality of the work you produce.

What you'll get
- Room to grow. We live and breathe scale-ups and with our own rapid business growth, you’ll have significant opportunity to shape your personal advancement.
- World-class team. Ambitious, passionate and collaborative, we have a proven track record and have serious investor backing. You’ll be challenged and inspired by team members daily.
- Company culture. We take the business seriously but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We collaborate, hack, blog, network with the tech scaleup sector and socialise with our members, and each other!
- Competitive salary and package, flexible working hours, a shiny Mac to call your own and regular team activities to involve yourself in.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer
jobs.description:
Due to Techspace rapidly expanding we are now looking for a senior front end developer to join our technology team.

Primarily programming Javascript and Typescript you’ll be working across web and mobile projects that help support the operational and community aspects of the business.

Reporting into the Head of Technology you will be working with an exciting team of people working towards bringing Techspace’s ideas into fruition. This role will require:

Stack
- React Native (Android, iOS)
- Ruby on Rails (HAML) / React
- Vue / Vuetify
- GRPC (grpc-web), REST services.

Systems
At Techspace you’ll have the opportunity to develop a wide range of internal and customer facing software to support the business on web, mobile and single board computers (IoT) including:

- Building information modelling
- Content management
- Customer relationship management
- Digital signage and wayfinding
- Enterprise resource planning
- Facilities management
- Management information dashboards
- Meeting room bookings, display and screen sharing
- Physical access control
- Network management

What you’ll be doing
- Contribute to our technical architecture.
- Improve agility, scalability and availability across all platforms.
- Work with our UI/UX designers, business analysts and product managers to drive new feature development.
- Ship highly available code for on premises mobile and single board computers.
- Maintain, bugfix and improve legacy code and address technical debt.

What you'll bring
- JavaScript (ES6+).
- React & React Native.
- Native mobile development in Swift, Obj-C and Java.
- Ruby on Rails HAML/React.
- Understanding of version control (Git).
- Be proud of what you work on and obsess about the quality of the work you produce.
- An interest in emerging as well as current programming languages, frameworks and design patterns.
- Desire to grow your skills, tackle interesting work and challenging problems.

Experience
- Extensive experience driving architecture, development and releases on iOS and Android platforms.
- Experience creating microservice RPC and REST front-ends.
- Rails, Django or similar monolithic front-end development.
- Worked in a startup/young company with sole front-end engineering responsibilities or designed and released open source software.

What you'll get
- Room to grow. We live and breathe scale-ups and with our own rapid business growth, you’ll have significant opportunity to shape your personal advancement.
- World-class team. Ambitious, passionate and collaborative, we have a proven track record and have serious investor backing. You’ll be challenged and inspired by team members daily.
- Company culture. We take the business seriously but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We collaborate, hack, blog, network with the tech scale-up sector and socialise with our members, and each other!
- Competitive salary and package, flexible working hours, a shiny Mac to call your own and regular team activities to involve yourself in.
